content:
Diagnosis
	1. Metastatic pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma with liver metastases
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	12 Jan 2024 Diagnostic liver biopsy

	Chemotherapy
	1. FOLFIRINOX commenced 25 Jan 2024
	2. Dose reduction to 80% from cycle 3 due to neutropenia
	3. Currently completing cycle 4

	Clinical studies
	Enrolled in Phase II trial of KDM6A-targeted therapy (PANDORA-01)

	Current disease status
	Stable disease on CT 15 Mar 2024

	Current issues
	1. Grade 2 peripheral neuropathy
	2. Intermittent nausea
	3. Fatigue WHO grade 2

	Summary of consultation
	Reviewed today prior to cycle 5 FOLFIRINOX. Latest CT shows stable disease with no new sites of metastatic disease. Main liver metastasis reduced from 4.2cm to 3.8cm. CA19-9 has decreased from 2500 to 1200. Performance status remains 1. Managing well on reduced dose chemotherapy with improved neutrophil counts. Continuing prophylactic GCSF. Peripheral neuropathy stable but limiting activities.

	Further investigations
	Repeat CT chest/abdomen/pelvis after cycle 6

	Medication prescribed
	Domperidone PRN for nausea

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 2 weeks pre-cycle 6
Trial follow up next week for KDM6A inhibitor administration

	Required GP actions
	Weekly FBC monitoring
Urgent contact if fever or new symptoms

cancer_timeline.value: Dose reduction to 80% from cycle 3 due to neutropenia
CT shows stable disease, main liver metastasis reduced from 4.2cm to 3.8cm
Enrolled in Phase II trial of KDM6A-targeted therapy (PANDORA-01)

status_updates.value: Metastatic pancreatic cancer showing stable disease on FOLFIRINOX. Managing well on reduced dose with improved neutrophil counts.
Stable disease with reduction in liver metastasis size and falling CA19-9
Continuing reduced dose FOLFIRINOX with GCSF prophylaxis
Review in 2 weeks pre-cycle 6, trial follow up next week for KDM6A inhibitor
